title.rendered: Explore Job Roles: Data Entry Keyer

content.rendered:
What is a Data Entry Keyer?

Data Entry Keyers operate data entry devices to verify data and prep materials for their companies. 

Where does a Data Entry Keyer work?

  • Data processing companies
  • Local government
  • Employment services

How much does a Data Entry Keyer make?

Based on real new grad salaries reported through Handshake, the median annual salary for a data entry keyer is $34,141.

What majors are typically interested in becoming Data Entry Keyers?

One’s major doesn’t necessarily determine their career, but these are some common majors of those who end up pursuing data entry keyer jobs.

  • Business majors
  • Computer science majors
Explore Data Entry Keyer job opportunities on Handshake.

Data Entry Keyer skills and competencies:

On top of a relevant degree and formal training, here are some professional skills that can help aspiring Data Entry Keyers succeed in their work:

  • Detail oriented
  • Strong typing skills
  • Knowledge of programming languages

What are some common questions about Data Entry Keyers?

Q: What are hiring managers looking for in a data entry clerk?

A: Since the role will heavily rely on attention to detail, make sure that your words and resume reflect your organization and previous experience doing similar tasks.
